name: Training Reports Guide
title: Training Reports Guide
body:
In your KnowBe4 account, you can view reports about your users' training progress. These reports include information such as how many users have completed their training content, how many users have not completed their training content, and how many users have acknowledged assigned policies. To access training reports, log in to your KnowBe4 account and navigate to Training > Reports.

Click the links below to learn about the different types of data you can view from your training reports. For more information about managing and monitoring training campaigns, see our Creating and Managing Training Campaigns article or our Monitoring Training Campaigns video.

Tip:We also offer a variety of reports through our Reporting feature. For more information about our Reporting feature, see our KSAT Reporting Guide.

Sign-up Reports

The Sign-up Reports section of the Reports subtab contains two reports: Users Who Have Logged In and Users Who Have Never Logged In. To view a report, click the View Report button under the report name. To download a CSV file of a report, click the CSV button under the report name.

The Users Who Have Logged In report lists your users’ email addresses when their account was created, and when they last logged in to their account.

The Users Who Have Never Logged In report lists your users’ email addresses and when their account was created.

Tip:If you would like to resend an account registration link to your users, navigate to your Dashboard. Then, copy the link at the bottom of the Training tile and send the link to your users.Alternatively, you can also send your users a notification to create their accounts. For more information about notifications, see our Training Campaign Notifications article (screenshot below).

Content Reports

In the Content Reports section of the Reports subtab, you can view a report to see which users have completed specific training content. You can filter this report by training courses, user groups, and timeframe. For more information about the filters you can apply to your report, see the screenshot and list below:

  1. Content: Click this drop-down menu to select one or more content items that you would like to include in your report.
    Important:To view your report, you must select at least one content item from this drop-down menu.
  2. Users: Click this drop-down menu to select one or more user groups that you would like to include in your report.
  3. Start: Click the calendar icon to select a start date.
  4. End: Click the calendar icon to select an end date.
  5. Include Archived Users: Enable this setting if you would like to include any archived users in your report.

Once you have added your desired filters, you will be able to view several reports for the selected content. For information about the types of available reports, see the table below:

Report Name Report Description
Users Who Have Started the Selected Content This report includes a list of users who have started the selected content within the date range.
Users Who Have Not Started the Selected Content This report includes a list of users who were assigned the content within the date range but have not started the content.
Users Who Have Not Completed the Selected Content This report includes a list of users who started their content within the date range but have not completed the content.
Users Who Have Not Started the Selected Content or Are in Progress This report includes a list of users who were assigned the selected content within the date range but have not started or finished the content.
Users Who Have Completed the Selected Content This report includes a list of users who completed the selected content within the date range.
Users Who Acknowledged Course-Attached Policies This report includes a list of users who acknowledged their course-attached policies within the date range.
Users Who Did Not Acknowledge Their Course-Attached Policies This report includes a list of users who were assigned the selected content within the date range but have not acknowledged their course-attached policies.
Important:The Users Who Acknowledged Course-Attached Policies and Users Who Did Not Acknowledge Their Course-Attached Policies reports include information about users who have or have not acknowledged course-attached policies. These policies are different from the policies in our policies feature.

images.alt:
The image displays the **Sign-up Reports** administration panel, which is dedicated to generating user activity data. The content is organized into two distinct report categories.

**Overall Context:** The section is headed by the bold title "Sign-up Reports," positioned above a horizontal dividing line.

**Report Category 1: Users Who Have Logged In**
*   **Title/Link:** "Users Who Have Logged In" (displayed in blue text, suggesting a hyperlink).
*   **Description:** "This report pulls a list of users who have logged in at least once."
*   **Action Buttons:** Two adjacent buttons are provided for output:
    1.  A primary, solid blue button labeled **View Report**.
    2.  A secondary, white-filled button with a blue outline and text, labeled **CSV**, which includes a downward-arrow download glyph.

**Report Category 2: Users Who Have Never Logged In**
*   **Title/Link:** "Users Who Have Never Logged In" (displayed in blue text, suggesting a hyperlink).
*   **Description:** "This report pulls a list of users who have never logged in."
*   **Action Buttons:** This section utilizes an identical button configuration to the first:
    1.  A primary, solid blue button labeled **View Report**.
    2.  A secondary, white-filled button with a blue outline and text, labeled **CSV**, which includes a downward-arrow download glyph.
images.context: report, click the CSV button under the report name.

images.alt:
This image displays a dashboard or report page for user activity tracking.

**Context and Title:**
The page title is **"Users Who Have Logged In"** (large, bold text). A navigational element is present in the upper right corner: a blue hyperlink labeled **"← Back To Reports"**.

**Data Structure (Table):**
The primary content is a vertically ruled, three-column data table.

**Column Headers (Left to Right):**
1.  **User**
2.  **Joined On** (Date format: MM/DD/YYYY)
3.  **Last Login At** (Date format: MM/DD/YYYY)

**Example Data Entries (Three Rows):**
| Column: User (Hyperlink) | Column: Joined On | Column: Last Login At |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| `demo.user1@demo.com` | `06/09/2021` | `11/29/2021` |
| `demo.user2@demo.com` | `07/09/2019` | `03/24/2020` |
| `demo.user3@demo.com` | `07/09/2019` | `08/10/2019` |

**UI Elements:**
*   User email addresses are styled as blue hyperlinks, suggesting drill-down functionality to individual user profiles or activity logs.
*   Data is aligned left under the "User" column and centrally aligned under the "Joined On" and "Last Login At" columns.
*   The table utilizes high-contrast white space and thin, light gray horizontal separators.
images.context: their account was created, and when they last logged in to their account.

images.alt:
This image displays a data report page titled **"Users Who Have Never Logged In"** in large, bold text.

**UI Elements and Navigation:**
*   A blue hyperlink labeled **"← Back To Reports"** is located in the upper right corner, indicating navigation back to the primary reports index.
*   Data is presented in a tabular format separated by thin horizontal lines.

**Table Structure and Data Fields:**
The table includes three columns:
1.  **User:** Contains the user's email address, displayed as a blue hyperlink (e.g., `demouser.a@demo.com`).
2.  **Joined On:** Displays the registration date in a slash-separated format (e.g., `07/09/2019`).
3.  **Last Login At:** This column is empty for all entries, consistent with the report's purpose.

**Sample Data Entries:**
*   **demouser.a@demo.com** / Joined On: 07/09/2019
*   **demouser.b@demo.com** / Joined On: 01/09/2020
*   **demouser.c@demo.com** / Joined On: 01/09/2020

images.alt:
A rectangular UI element, styled as a light gray box with rounded corners and a soft drop shadow, contains instructions and a specific URL.

**Text and Content:**
The primary text reads: "Share this link to invite your users to start their training:" followed by a URL presented in bold text: **https://training.knowbe4.com/ui/login**.

**UI Element:**
Immediately following the URL is a small, dark gray icon representing stacked documents (a copy icon), indicating a function to copy the preceding URL to the clipboard. The overall element serves as a prompt to distribute the training login link to users.

This image depicts a configuration screen for **Content Reports**. The user interface allows filtering report data based on specific content, user scope, and a date range before generating specific performance reports.

### UI Structure and Configuration Elements

**Header:** The page title is **Content Reports**.

**Configuration Filters:**

1.  **Content Selection (1):** Displays a selected content item tag: **2023 Kevin Mitnick Security Awareness Training - 45 minutes**. The tag includes a close icon (`X`) for removal.
2.  **User Scope (2):** A dropdown menu currently set to **All Users**.
3.  **Reporting Period (3, 4):**
    *   **Start Date (3):** Set to **11/20/2022**. Subtext: *Start of the reporting period*.
    *   **End Date (4):** Set to **11/20/2023**. Subtext: *End of the reporting period*. Both fields include a calendar icon.
4.  **Archived User Toggle (5):** A disabled toggle switch labeled **Include Archived Users**.

### Available Reports

The page lists three report types based on user progress relative to the selected content and date range. Each report type includes a descriptive text block and two action buttons: **View Report** (primary blue button) and **CSV** (secondary outline button with a download icon).

| Report Title | Description | Action Buttons |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **Users Who Started the Selected Content** | *This report pulls a list of users who have started the selected content within the given date range.* | View Report, CSV |
| **Users Who Have Not Started the Selected Content** | *This report pulls a list of users who were assigned the content within the given date range but have not yet started the content.* | View Report, CSV |
| **Users Who Have Not Completed the Selected Content** | *This report pulls a list of users who started their content within the given date range but have not yet completed the content.* | View Report, CSV |
